title: Trio Wins 2024 Nobel Prize In Economics For Work On Wealth Inequality
content: The Nobel Prize in Economics was awarded on Monday to Turkish-American Daron Acemoglu and British-Americans Simon Johnson and James Robinson for research into wealth inequality between nations.
summary: The Nobel Prize in Economics was awarded on Monday to Turkish-American Daron Acemoglu and British-Americans Simon Johnson and James Robinson for research into wealth inequality between nations.

title: 3 Economists Get Nobel Prize For Study On Institutions And Prosperity
content: Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson and James Robinson won the 2024 Nobel economics prize "for studies of how institutions are formed and affect prosperity", the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences said on Monday.
summary: Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson and James Robinson won the 2024 Nobel economics prize "for studies of how institutions are formed and affect prosperity", the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences said on Monday.

title: WHO Adds First Mpox Vaccine To Its List, Expected To Speed Up Distribution
content: The WHO said Friday it had for the first time prequalified a mpox vaccine -- a move expected to speed up access to the jabs to fight an epidemic raging in Africa.
summary: The WHO said Friday it had for the first time prequalified a mpox vaccine -- a move expected to speed up access to the jabs to fight an epidemic raging in Africa.

title: "Trudeau Government's Political Agenda": India's Full Statement On Canada
content: India has strongly rejected Canada's allegations linking top Indian diplomats to an investigation in their country, calling it a "political agenda of the Trudeau government".
summary: India has strongly rejected Canada's allegations linking top Indian diplomats to an investigation in their country, calling it a "political agenda of the Trudeau government".

title: Poorest Countries Face Highest Debt Burden For 18 Years: World Bank
content: The world's 26 poorest economies are facing the most significant debt burden since 2006, the World Bank announced in a new report published Sunday.
summary: The world's 26 poorest economies are facing the most significant debt burden since 2006, the World Bank announced in a new report published Sunday.

title: "Preposterous Imputations": Trudeau's Escalation, India's Strong Rebuttal
content: India on Monday issued a sharp rebuttal to Canada, rejecting allegations of its High Commissioner being a 'person of interest' in a murder investigation, describing them as "preposterous imputations."
summary: India on Monday issued a sharp rebuttal to Canada, rejecting allegations of its High Commissioner being a 'person of interest' in a murder investigation, describing them as "preposterous imputations."

title: China's Military Encircles Taiwan, US Calls It "Unwarranted"
content: The United States said China's actions were "unwarranted" and risk "escalation" as it called on Beijing to act with restraint.
summary: The United States said China's actions were "unwarranted" and risk "escalation" as it called on Beijing to act with restraint.

title: "Completely Unacceptable": EU Slams Israel Attacks On Lebanon Peacekeepers
content: A series of Israeli attacks have injured United Nations peacekeepers in southern Lebanon.
summary: A series of Israeli attacks have injured United Nations peacekeepers in southern Lebanon.

title: Ukraine Destroys Russian Military Transport Plane
content: Ukraine has stepped up attacks inside Russian territory in recent months, targeting military sites and energy facilities, aiming to upend Russian military logistics.
summary: Ukraine has stepped up attacks inside Russian territory in recent months, targeting military sites and energy facilities, aiming to upend Russian military logistics.

title: French Government Looks At New Immigration Law In 2025
content: The French authorities want to adopt a new immigration law next year, a spokeswoman said, as the new right-wing government seeks to crack down on immigration.
summary: The French authorities want to adopt a new immigration law next year, a spokeswoman said, as the new right-wing government seeks to crack down on immigration.

title: 1 In 4 Adults Suspect Undiagnosed ADHD Due To Social Media Influence: Study
content: While attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder -- also known as ADHD -- is typically thought of as a childhood condition, a new study on Monday showed that one in four or 25 per cent of adults in America suspect they may have it but is undiagnosed.
summary: While attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder -- also known as ADHD -- is typically thought of as a childhood condition, a new study on Monday showed that one in four or 25 per cent of adults in America suspect they may have it but is undiagnosed.

title: Pakistan 'Vigilantes' Behind Rise In Online Blasphemy Cases
content: Hundreds of young men are standing trial in Pakistan courts, accused of making blasphemous statements online or in WhatsApp groups, an offence for which arrests have exploded in recent years.
summary: Hundreds of young men are standing trial in Pakistan courts, accused of making blasphemous statements online or in WhatsApp groups, an offence for which arrests have exploded in recent years.

title: Seeing Double In 'Twins Capital Of World': Almost Every Family Has Them
content: The global average birth rate for twins is around 12 per 1,000 births -- but in Igbo-Ora, it is thought to be closer to 50 per 1,000, according to scientific studies and hospital records.
summary: The global average birth rate for twins is around 12 per 1,000 births -- but in Igbo-Ora, it is thought to be closer to 50 per 1,000, according to scientific studies and hospital records.

title: Is Life Possible On Europa, Jupiter Moon? NASA To Investigate
content: The Europa Clipper mission will allow the US space agency to uncover new details about the moon, which scientists believe could hold an ocean of liquid water beneath its icy surface.
summary: The Europa Clipper mission will allow the US space agency to uncover new details about the moon, which scientists believe could hold an ocean of liquid water beneath its icy surface.

title: Afghan Taekwondo Champion Faces Death Threats For Criticizing Taliban
content: A 21-year-old Afghan Taekwondo champion has received over 5,000 threat calls and messages for criticising the Taliban's ban on women's sports.
summary: A 21-year-old Afghan Taekwondo champion has received over 5,000 threat calls and messages for criticising the Taliban's ban on women's sports.

title: Ukrainian Journalist Dies In Russian Detention, Kyiv Says
content: Ukrainian journalist Victoria Roshchyna disappeared in August 2022 during a reporting mission in Russian-controlled territory, and her whereabouts remained unknown for months.
summary: Ukrainian journalist Victoria Roshchyna disappeared in August 2022 during a reporting mission in Russian-controlled territory, and her whereabouts remained unknown for months.

title: "Trump Should Do The Same": Harris After Releasing Medical Report
content: Kamala Harris urged voters to question Donald Trumps transparency regarding his health and policy plans.
summary: Kamala Harris urged voters to question Donald Trumps transparency regarding his health and policy plans.

title: North Korea Set To Blow Up Cross-Border Roads With South: Seoul
content: North Korea on Friday accused South Korea of sending drones to scatter a "huge number" of anti-North leaflets over Pyongyang.
summary: North Korea on Friday accused South Korea of sending drones to scatter a "huge number" of anti-North leaflets over Pyongyang.

title: DNA Study Shows Christopher Columbus Was A Jew From Spain
content: The research, led by Spanish scientists suggests Christopher Columbus concealed Sephardic Jewish roots to escape persecution.
summary: The research, led by Spanish scientists suggests Christopher Columbus concealed Sephardic Jewish roots to escape persecution.

title: What Is THAAD, The Advanced US Anti-Missile Battery Being Sent To Israel
content: The United States has deployed one of its most advanced missile defence systems, the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD), along with 100 US troops to Israel.
summary: The United States has deployed one of its most advanced missile defence systems, the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD), along with 100 US troops to Israel.
